column4: http://paste.ubuntu.com/738880/ Can anyone help me with this one?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/738880/ dovecot ssl error. Can anyone help?
Seems pretty straightforward.  Set ssl_cert.
What value?
What should I be pointing it at.
The certificate.
Which is where... I noticed that during the upgrade a number of certificates failed to generate for some reason.
Upgrade of what?  It would be whereever you put it when you created it.
Performed the in-place upgrade of 11.04 -> 11.10. During that process I saw a number of messages on the console about ssl certificates failing to generate.
odd.  Anyway, where is the certificate you made for dovecot?
What certificate... Before it just worked...
I highly doubt that.  You would have had to make a certificate when you first set it up, unless you weren't using SSL, in which case you should turn off that option.
OK will take a quick look in the conf file.
Hang on there.
http://paste.ubuntu.com/738887/ I can't see any mention of SSL in there...
Check /etc/dovecot/conf.d/01-dovecot-postfix.conf
http://paste.ubuntu.com/738887/ I can't see any mention of SSL in there...
Ignore... Will do
No such file or directory... It doesn't exist
well, then check whatever other files are under /etc/dovecot/ then.
etc/dovecot/conf.d or just etc/dovecot?
Thanks for the help... I've got as far as it being SSL related, just need to find out what. Will log back in here later once I've had some sleep.
all of it
